title: Google\Cloud\Speech\V1beta1\RecognitionConfig
name: RecognitionConfig
description:
Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.speech.v1beta1.RecognitionConfig

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: getEncoding
methods.description:
Required Encoding of audio data sent in all RecognitionAudio messages.

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.speech.v1beta1.RecognitionConfig.AudioEncoding encoding = 1;

methods.name: setEncoding
methods.description:
Required Encoding of audio data sent in all RecognitionAudio messages.

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.speech.v1beta1.RecognitionConfig.AudioEncoding encoding = 1;

params.name: var
params.description: Required Encoding of audio data sent in all RecognitionAudio messages.

methods.name: getSampleRate
methods.description:
Required Sample rate in Hertz of the audio data sent in all RecognitionAudio messages. Valid values are: 8000-48000.

16000 is optimal. For best results, set the sampling rate of the audio source to 16000 Hz. If that's not possible, use the native sample rate of the audio source (instead of re-sampling).

Generated from protobuf field int32 sample_rate = 2;

methods.name: setSampleRate
methods.description:
Required Sample rate in Hertz of the audio data sent in all RecognitionAudio messages. Valid values are: 8000-48000.

16000 is optimal. For best results, set the sampling rate of the audio source to 16000 Hz. If that's not possible, use the native sample rate of the audio source (instead of re-sampling).

Generated from protobuf field int32 sample_rate = 2;

params.name: var
params.description:
Required Sample rate in Hertz of the audio data sent in all RecognitionAudio messages. Valid values are: 8000-48000.

16000 is optimal. For best results, set the sampling rate of the audio source to 16000 Hz. If that's not possible, use the native sample rate of the audio source (instead of re-sampling).

methods.name: getLanguageCode
methods.description:
Optional The language of the supplied audio as a BCP-47 language tag.

Example: "en-GB" https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt If omitted, defaults to "en-US". See Language Support for a list of the currently supported language codes.

Generated from protobuf field string language_code = 3;

methods.name: setLanguageCode
methods.description:
Optional The language of the supplied audio as a BCP-47 language tag.

Example: "en-GB" https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt If omitted, defaults to "en-US". See Language Support for a list of the currently supported language codes.

Generated from protobuf field string language_code = 3;

params.name: var
params.description:
Optional The language of the supplied audio as a BCP-47 language tag.

Example: "en-GB" https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt If omitted, defaults to "en-US". See Language Support for a list of the currently supported language codes.

methods.name: getMaxAlternatives
methods.description:
Optional Maximum number of recognition hypotheses to be returned.

Specifically, the maximum number of SpeechRecognitionAlternative messages within each SpeechRecognitionResult. The server may return fewer than max_alternatives. Valid values are 0-30. A value of 0 or 1 will return a maximum of one. If omitted, will return a maximum of one.

Generated from protobuf field int32 max_alternatives = 4;

methods.name: setMaxAlternatives
methods.description:
Optional Maximum number of recognition hypotheses to be returned.

Specifically, the maximum number of SpeechRecognitionAlternative messages within each SpeechRecognitionResult. The server may return fewer than max_alternatives. Valid values are 0-30. A value of 0 or 1 will return a maximum of one. If omitted, will return a maximum of one.

Generated from protobuf field int32 max_alternatives = 4;

params.name: var
params.description:
Optional Maximum number of recognition hypotheses to be returned.

Specifically, the maximum number of SpeechRecognitionAlternative messages within each SpeechRecognitionResult. The server may return fewer than max_alternatives. Valid values are 0-30. A value of 0 or 1 will return a maximum of one. If omitted, will return a maximum of one.

methods.name: getProfanityFilter
methods.description:
Optional If set to true, the server will attempt to filter out profanities, replacing all but the initial character in each filtered word with asterisks, e.g. "f***". If set to false or omitted, profanities won't be filtered out.

Generated from protobuf field bool profanity_filter = 5;

methods.name: setProfanityFilter
methods.description:
Optional If set to true, the server will attempt to filter out profanities, replacing all but the initial character in each filtered word with asterisks, e.g. "f***". If set to false or omitted, profanities won't be filtered out.

Generated from protobuf field bool profanity_filter = 5;
